alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 11:42PM EDT until June 20 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Heavy rainfall may lead to minor flooding across much of Surry County. From 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen across the western two-thirds of Surry county during the last several hours. Additional rainfall will move into this region over the next couple of hours. Minor flooding in poor drainage and low-lying areas is likely. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Surry. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the region. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brushy Fork, Bull Creek, Ararat River, Big Creek, Beaver Creek and Beaverdam Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Elkin... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Bottom... Mountain Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
